--- title: "Data Visualization in R" date: 2024-09-15 categories: [R, Data Visualization, ggplot2] --- # Visualizing heart disease death rates using ggplot2 ::: {.cell} ::: The National Center of Health Statistics [has published data](https://data.cdc.gov/NCHS/NCHS-Age-adjusted-Death-Rates-for-Selected-Major-C/6rkc-nb2q/about_data) on age-adjusted death rates for five leading causes of death in the United States between 1900 - 2018. Let's look at visualization strategies to highlight different insights from the data. Shoutout to [Albert Rapp's YouTube video on linecharts](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nDa6aHxiSYQ&list=PLBnFxG6owe1HRvUL6A5QNF_8ujP8NdLMc&index=7). I learned a lot of this code from Albert's excellent video tutorial. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df <- read_csv("https://data.cdc.gov/resource/6rkc-nb2q.csv") sysfonts::font_add_google('Merriweather') # Important step to enable showtext font rendering! showtext_auto() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} title_text <- 'It took 100 years for the **Heart Disease Death Rate**
to recover to levels observed in 1900' df |> filter(leading_causes == "Heart Disease") |> ggplot(aes(year, age_adjusted_death_rate, color = leading_causes)) + geom_line(linewidth = 1.5) + labs(title = "Major causes of mortality") + theme_minimal( base_size = 24, base_family = 'Merriweather' ) + labs( x = "Year", y = element_blank(), title = title_text, subtitle = "Age-Adjusted Death Rate (per 100,000)", caption = "Source: National Center for Health Statistics" ) + gghighlight( leading_causes == "Heart Disease", year <= 2000, use_direct_label = FALSE, use_group_by = FALSE, unhighlighted_params = list(color = "grey80", linewidth = 1) ) + annotate( 'text', x = 1992, y = 550, size = 5.5, label = "Heart Disease Death Rate", fontface = "bold", color = "skyblue2" ) + scale_color_manual(values = "skyblue2") + theme( legend.position = "none", panel.grid.minor = element_blank(), panel.grid.major = element_line(linewidth = 0.5, linetype = 2), plot.title.position = "plot", text = element_text(color = "grey20"), axis.text = element_text(color = "grey40"), plot.title = ggtext::element_markdown(color = "grey20", family = "Merriweather"), plot.subtitle = element_text( color = "grey30", size = rel(0.8), margin = margin(b=8, unit = 'mm') ), plot.caption = element_text(size = rel(0.6), color = "grey20") ) + annotate( 'segment', x = 1900, xend = 2000, y = 265, yend = 265, linetype = 2, linewidth = 1, color = "grey10" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](ggplot2_package_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
